alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Dale, southern Henry and north central Houston Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 115 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Headland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Headland, Kinsey, Ashford, Webb, Columbia, Newville, Haleburg, Sylvan Grove, Echo, Tumbleton, Kirkland Crossroads, Blackwood, Sigma, Capps, Grandberry Crossroads, Pearce, Barber, Pleasant Plains, Goldberg Field and Headland Municipal A/P. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
